In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Here's the code to create a new column named "ym" that contains the year-month combination of the DateTime column "dt":
```julia
using Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map(x -> x.year*100+x.month, df[:dt])
end
```
This code uses the `map` function to apply a function to each element of the "dt" column and extract the year and month from the DateTime object using the `.year` and `.month` properties. The resulting year-month combination is then concatenated into an integer in the format "yyyymm".

You can call this function on your DataFrame by passing it as an argument: `add_yearmonth(df)`. This will add a new column named "ym" to your DataFrame with the desired values.
